alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 2:04PM PST until March 10 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Salinas River At Paso Robles affecting San Luis Obispo County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...The river has reached minor flood stage around 29 feet. * WHERE...Salinas River At Paso Robles. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Halcon Road near Atascadero floods and washes out. At 29.0 feet, Flooding in and around atascadero. Backs up atascadero creek into river gardens neighborhood, floods highway 41. Erosion threats along entire reach, threatens homes on banks, agricultural land, low-lying areas south of highway 41 bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2PM PST Friday the stage was 29 feet. - Forecast...The river will remain in minor flood stage through early this evening before falling below flood stage during the overnight hours. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
